page.title: 02WEATHER
page.content: The weather station in Low Etherley has accurate instruments and reports daily to the Meteorological Office. Records began in 1971. _ The climate is cool and cloudy. Average annual temperature is 7.9C, ranging from 2.4C in January to 14.3C in July. Extremes are 30.0C and -14.1C and a grass temperature of -22.0C. There are 76 air and 155 ground frosts yearly. Rainfall is low at 792mm annually as this is a 'rain shadow' area. Snow is frequent since the village is high and exposed to the north and east. Snow falls on 46 days and lies on 32. Annual sunshine is low at 1300 hours, the region being prone to low cloud from the North Sea. Fog occurs on 28 days and gales on 12 days, the highest wind was 91 mph. Thunder is heard on only 7 days.
